paper.title: COMPARISON OF STOCK SELECTION METHODS: AN EMPIRICAL RESEARCH ON THE BORSA ISTANBUL
paper.abstract: This paper compares the performances of stock selection methods developed by artificial neural network (ANN), second order stochastic dominance (SSD), and Markowitz portfolio optimization by generating annual portfolios whose stocks are selected from several types of indexes traded in the Borsa Istanbul. Daily returns in SSD and Markowitz, and annual ratios in ANN models, are taken as inputs, with the following annual returns as outputs. By the perspective of stock selection literature, this study carries unique value for including comparisons of these methods with the purpose of generating portfolios with higher returns. Thus, two questions emerge: Are these methods able to overcome losses during financial crises and bear or bull periods, and can they provide positive alpha? Results indicate that average returns of portfolios generated by ANN are relatively higher than SSD and Markowitz, but all three models provide positive alpha over indexes. However, none of the models could overcome negative returns during economic crises.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心研究是比较不同股票选择方法（人工神经网络、二阶随机占优和马科维茨投资组合优化）在生成投资组合时的表现，旨在提高投资组合的回报率。这直接涉及投资组合管理的核心问题，即如何选择和优化资产组合以实现更高的收益。
